intro: Cynanchum arboreum, commonly known as the American snake vine, is a perennial climbing plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-green flowers with a distinctive horn-shaped calyx, followed by follicles containing toxic seeds. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the eastern United States. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
